text: Does anyone know of a good solution for a tabs module, in particular allowing other module(s) to be used inside each tab section somehow?
I’ve generally built them using repeaters in the past, looping over a list of items with a “tab” field (for the label) and then a combination of content fields
Yeah, thought maybe someone had some clever workaround they could share though. It seems like tabs needing to have custom content wouldn’t be that uncommon.

Yeah, that’s how I’ve done as well. But then you’re basically making a new module for each unique scenario. Would be nice to have an “all-in-one” tab module somehow. Which would mean keeping the tab module itself simple, and being able to put other modules or content inside the tabbed content.

Only hacky solution I can think of would be a custom section with a class that you could then use with JS, so you build out your columns/rows as normal in the editor, and then in the public view use a function to get all the headers or some other common element to get the tab names, and then hide all rows except the first and generate the tab layout that way.
but that would also be really easy for a marketer to break
